ygData.subject: Re: Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort of)
ygData.msgSnippet: Not that I ve done this, my highest charecter is still level 17, but take a look at it through a role playing veiw..... Father is a retired high level Warrior
ygData.messageBody:
Not that I've done this, my highest charecter is still level 17, but take a
look at it through a role playing veiw.....
Father is a retired high level Warrior who finds a nice lady, settles down
and has kids....
Son grows up and wants to be a warrior like daddy, so he enters that
profession
Father doesnt want son to go through what he did, but he accepts the fact
that son wants to do this. But, Father doesnt want son to be in too much
danger if he can help it, so he gives son his old armor and weapons....
Much like Nobles of ancient times used to inherit thier armor/weapons from
older family members, and were no where near as good as thier elders when
they aquired it....
Just a different point of view....
Rolande.
-----Original Message-----
From: John Kim <kim@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, July 22, 1999 12:27 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Blackened Iron Armor *SPOILER* (sort of)


>From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
>On Thu, 22 Jul 1999, Kyle Q wrote:
>>
>> Sorry, I just had to reply to this, and then I'll let the subject drop
>> forever. Enough has been said about twinking. I have to say, you have to
be
>> a real jerk to give somebody flak because they are twinked. This is
called
>> JEALOUSY folks. Get over it.
>
>You're applying single-player game mentalities to a
>multi-player game. Spawns that give things like rubicite are
>a limited resource. If someone uses his high level character
>to get equipment like that for his low level characters, he is
>depriving others of the chance to get that item, thus
>increasing the camping problem on that spawn. It is not
>jealousy, it is a legitimate gripe that someone has figured
>out a way to cut in line and get two or more of something,
>when you're still waiting in line to get one.
>
>(And I'll repeat what I said last time: The real meta-issue
>behind this problem is server overcrowding. If the servers
>weren't so crowded, this would be much less of a problem
>because the "lines" would be shorter or nonexistant.)
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
>
